Package bricker.main

Class BrickerGameManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • danogl.GameManager
      • bricker.main.BrickerGameManager
  • public class BrickerGameManager
extends danogl.GameManager
    Manages the overall game logic for a brick-breaking game. This class is responsible for initializing and managing game components, including game objects like balls, bricks, and paddles, and handling their interactions. It sets up the game environment, manages collisions, and keeps track of the game state. Key responsibilities include: - Setting up the game scene with necessary objects. - Managing collisions and their effects. - Handling user input and game progression.
    Version:
    Java 11.
    Author:
    Noam Shabat, Samuel Hayat

    • Constructor Detail

      • BrickerGameManager

        public BrickerGameManager​(java.lang.String windowTitle,
                          danogl.util.Vector2 windowDimensionsVector)
        Default constructor! Constructs a new BrickerGameManager with the specified window title and dimensions. This constructor initializes the game with the default number of rows and columns for the brick's layout. (default row = 7, column = 8)
        Parameters:
        windowTitle - The title of the game window.
        windowDimensionsVector - The dimensions of the game window in pixels.

      • BrickerGameManager

        public BrickerGameManager​(java.lang.String windowTitle,
                          danogl.util.Vector2 windowDimensions,
                          int numberOfRows,
                          int numberOfCols)
        Non-default Constructor! Constructs a new BrickerGameManager with custom settings for the game window, rows, and columns.
        Parameters:
        windowTitle - The title of the game window.
        windowDimensions - The dimensions of the game window in pixels.
        numberOfRows - The number of bricks per row
        numberOfCols - The number of bricks per column

    • Method Detail

      • initializeGame

        public void initializeGame​(danogl.gui.ImageReader imageReader,
                           danogl.gui.SoundReader soundReader,
                           danogl.gui.UserInputListener inputListener,
                           danogl.gui.WindowController windowController)
        Initializes game components and sets up the game environment. This includes creating the ball, paddle, bricks, and setting up collision logic and game borders.
        Overrides:
        initializeGame in class danogl.GameManager
        Parameters:
        imageReader - Contains a single method: readImage, which reads an image from disk. See its documentation for help.
        soundReader - Contains a single method: readSound, which reads a wav file from disk. See its documentation for help.
        inputListener - Contains a single method: isKeyPressed, which returns whether a given key is currently pressed by the user or not. See its documentation.
        windowController - Contains an array of helpful, self-explanatory methods concerning the window.

      • createHeartCounters

        private void createHeartCounters​(danogl.gui.ImageReader imageReader)
        Creates everything related to the lives. This method initializes and adds the graphical and numerical life counters to the game objects.
        Parameters:
        imageReader - An instance of ImageReader to read the heart image.

      • createGameBricks

        private void createGameBricks​(danogl.gui.ImageReader imageReader)
        Creates and arranges the bricks for the game. This method calculates the size and position of each brick based on the game's window dimensions and the predefined number of rows and columns. It then initializes each brick and adds it to the game objects.
        Parameters:
        imageReader - An instance of ImageReader for reading the brick image.

      • createStrategyFactory

        public FactoryCollisionStrategy createStrategyFactory()
        Initializes and returns a new FactoryCollisionStrategy object. This method sets up the necessary components for collision strategies used in the game, including images and sounds for various game elements like the paddle, heart, and mock ball. It creates and configures a FactoryCollisionStrategy instance with these elements, along with other game state information.
        Returns:
        An instance of FactoryCollisionStrategy, fully initialized with the necessary game elements and state information. This instance can then be used to generate and manage collision strategies throughout the game.

      • createGamePaddle

        private void createGamePaddle​(danogl.gui.ImageReader imageReader)
        Creates the paddle for the game. This method initializes the paddle with its image, size, and input listener, and then adds it to the game objects.
        Parameters:
        imageReader - An instance of ImageReader for reading the paddle image.

      • createGameBall

        private void createGameBall​(danogl.gui.ImageReader imageReader,
                            danogl.gui.SoundReader soundReader)
        Creates the ball for the game. This method initializes the ball with its image and sound, sets its initial velocity and position, and then adds it to the game objects.
        Parameters:
        imageReader - An instance of ImageReader for reading the ball image.
        soundReader - An instance of SoundReader for reading the collision sound.

      • createGameBorders

        private void createGameBorders()
        Creates the borders for the game. This method initializes the top, left, and right borders of the game area to prevent the ball from going out of bounds.

      • createGameBackground

        private void createGameBackground​(danogl.gui.ImageReader imageReader)
        Creates the background for the game. This method initializes the background with an image and sets it to cover the entire game window.
        Parameters:
        imageReader - An instance of ImageReader for reading the background image.

      • update

        public void update​(float deltaTime)
        Updates the game state. This method is called once per frame and is responsible for updating the game's logic based on the time that has passed since the last frame.
        Overrides:
        update in class danogl.GameManager
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - The time elapsed since the last update call, in seconds.

      • updateCamera

        private void updateCamera()
        this function is do to check if the camera special affect is met. and in the case it is, deactivate the camera

      • isKeyWPressed

        public void isKeyWPressed()
        Checks for player input to quit the game. If the specific quit key is pressed, the game ends.

      • checkForGameEnd

        private void checkForGameEnd()
        Checks for game end conditions such as winning or losing and takes appropriate actions.

      • checkLivesStatus

        private void checkLivesStatus​(Ball ball)
        Checks the status of player lives and handles the restart of the turn if needed.
        Parameters:
        ball - The ball object representing the player's ball.

      • isObjectIsOutsideBorders

        private boolean isObjectIsOutsideBorders​(danogl.GameObject object)
        Checks if a game object is outside the game borders.
        Parameters:
        object - The game object to check.
        Returns:
        True if the object is outside the borders, false otherwise.

      • restartTurn

        private void restartTurn​(Ball ball)
        Restarts the turn by setting the ball's position and velocity to default values.
        Parameters:
        ball - The ball object to restart the turn for.

      • setRandomBallVelocity

        public void setRandomBallVelocity​(danogl.GameObject gameObject)
        Sets a random velocity for the ball at the start of the game or after a restart.
        Parameters:
        gameObject - The ball object whose velocity is to be set.

      • createMockBalls

        public void createMockBalls​(danogl.GameObject thisObj)
        Creates two mock balls in the game.
        Parameters:
        thisObj - the MockBall that is being created.

      • createOneMockBall

        private void createOneMockBall​(danogl.GameObject thisObj)
        This function is responsible to creat one MockBall to be entered to the game.
        Parameters:
        thisObj - the MockBall that is being created.

      • setRandomMockBallVelocity

        private void setRandomMockBallVelocity​(MockBall mockBall)
        this function sets a random Mock Ball Velocity on receiving a Mock Ball to be added to the game.
        Parameters:
        mockBall - the MockBall that we are setting his Velocity.

      • activateCamera

        public void activateCamera​(danogl.gui.rendering.Camera camera)
        Activates the camera within the game. This method sets the current view to the camera provided, marks the camera as active, and updates the hit state based on the ball's current collision counter. Usage of this method is essential for scenarios where the game's view needs to be focused or altered through a different camera perspective, often used for special effects or focusing on specific game elements.
        Parameters:
        camera - The Camera object to be activated. It is expected that this object is not null and properly configured before being passed to this method.

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        The entry point of the program. This method initializes the game manager and starts the game. It supports command-line arguments to customize the number of rows and bricks per row.
        Parameters:
        args - Command-line arguments. The first argument is the number of rows, and the second is the number of bricks per row. If not provided, default values are used.
